SUBJECT: SEEDLING BOXES
OFFADD: 1249 S. Vinnell Way, SUITE 200 Boise ID 83709
DESC:
General Information

Document Type: Presolicitation Notice

Solicitation Number: AG-0261-S-13-0079

Classification Code: 81 - Containers, Packaging, and Packing Supplies

Set Aside: Small Business

NAICS Code - 322211 -Corrugated and Solid Fiber Box Manufacturing
Contracting Office Address
U. S. Department of Agriculture, Southwest Idaho/Nevada Acquisition Center (SWINAC), 1249 S. Vinnell Way, Ste. 200, Boise, ID 83709-1663, UNITED STATES

Description

Supply and deliver 32 x 14-1/2 x 9-3/4 Robo bottoms 1" overlap self-locking top C flute 275# 69/33/69 Kraft with hinged hand holes. Fully recyclable wax impregnation on the inside and outside liners. Vynamil water resistant starch. Extended glue tab on top flaps. This is a commercial acquisition; therefore, award will be made in accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Part 12. This acquisition is a competitive small business set-aside.

Other information for vendors is listed below:

Registration requires a D-U-N-S Number from Dun and Bradstreet and may take up to three weeks to process. Recommend registering immediately in order to be eligible for timely award. Vendors must have a valid D-U-N-S Number. Request a D-U-N-S Number from Duns and Bradstreet on the web at http://www.dnb.com/us/duns_update/

Register in the System for Award Management (SAM) and complete the Online Representations and Certifications Application in SAM as stated in the solicitation. Vendors can access SAM at http://www.sam.gov.

The solicitation will be issued in approximately 3-10 days via the Fed Biz Opps website at https://www.fbo.gov. Any amendments will be posted on FBO as well. Paper copies of the solicitation and amendments will not be mailed and no telephone requests for the solicitation will be accepted.

Point of Contact:
Diana Early, Contracting Officer, Phone (208) 373-4134, E-mail: dearly@fs.fed.us

CONTACT: James T. Smith , Contracting Officer, Phone 215.737.2713, Fax 215.737.7942, Email James.T.Smith@dla.mil - William McClenahan, Supervsory Contract Specialist, Phone 2157377786, Fax 2157377942, Email William.McClenahan@dla.mil
SUBJECT: Federal Logistics Information System (FLIS) Portfolio WebMethods Services
POPADDRESS:
DLA Logistics Information Service (DLIS) (LT)
74 N. Washington Avenue,
Sutie 7
Battle Creek, MI
DESC:
The objectives of this PWS and the resulting contract are to
provide a vehicle through which the Contractor shall provide dedicated resources to facilitate resolution of technical issues specifically focusing on the proprietary webMethods software. Technical issues are reported to SAG by creating an Empower ticket.  Empower is a web-based Product Support System designed to proactively assist customers by providing timely information and problem solutions. The initiation of an Empower ticket is the only escalation vehicle that can customers can leverage for SAG to provide resolution of technical issues with the proprietary software as well as engineering solutions and with installation support for this proprietary software.

 

The accomplishment of these objectives requires skill and knowledge across the full spectrum of the proprietary pieces of the  WebMethods Business Process Management Suite but especially focused on the Composite Framework Development (CAF) and My WebMethods Server (MWS) components.  Additionally, specific knowledge of proprietary WebMethods code and systems configurations with reach-back to product development is required to troubleshoot and resolve many technical issues.  The reach-back to product development is essential as many of the technical issues require engineering solution to change WebMethods software and its proprietary code.

CONTACT: Questions regarding this solicitation should be emailed to dibbsBSM@dla.mil

SUBJECT: Procurement of NSN 2915-01-566-6706, SPRAYBAR, MAIN, AIRCRAFT
DESC:
MODIFICATION 0001 ISSUED June 16, 2013 to change solicitation date from June 12, 2013 to June 16, 2013.

Provide NSN 2915-01-566-6706, SPRAYBAR, MAIN, AIRCRAFT. PR 0048405019, CAGE 99207 General Electric Company, Part Number 6057T31G03. CAGE 71895 Delavan Inc., Part Number 6057T31G03. Quantity of 705 each.

Specifications, plans or drawings relating to the procurement described are not available and cannot be furnished by the Government. DLA Aviation does not currently have an approved technical data package for this item, please do not submit requests. The only approved sources for this item are General Electric Company (CAGE 99207, P/N 4060966) and Delavan Inc. (CAGE 99207, P/N 4060966). Any manufacturer, other than the approved sources, who would like to submit a proposal on this item, must submit a complete source approval package (SAR). This solicitation will result in a firm fixed-price contract. The requirement is for 705 each, FOB Destination, Inspection and Acceptance at Origin. The required delivery is 250 days ARO. PPIRS applies. The final contract award decision may be based upon a combination of price, past performance and other evaluation factors as described in the solicitation. A copy of the solicitation will be available via the DLA Intranet Bid Board System (DIBBS) at https://www.dibbs.bsm.dla.mil/solicitations to obtain a copy of the solicitation. Proposals may be faxed to the Bid Custodian via FAX number (804) 279-4165. A paper copy of this solicitation will not be available to requestors. The anticipated solicitation issue date is June 16, 2013. The anticipated closing date is July 15, 2013.
